docs.snippet: Imposing a temporary travel ban on citizens from seven Muslim countries, President Donald Trump said the move would help protect the United States from terrorism. But less than one-third of Americans believe the move makes them "more safe," accord...
docs.lead_paragraph: Imposing a temporary travel ban on citizens from seven Muslim countries, President Donald Trump said the move would help protect the United States from terrorism. But less than one-third of Americans believe the move makes them "more safe," according to a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll released on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: A Third of Americans Think Trump's Travel Ban Will Make Them Safer
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: A Third of Americans Think Trump's Travel Ban Will Make Them Safer

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump will likely face questions about  his executive order restricting some travel to the United States when he meets with the CEOs of major U.S. companies at the White House on Friday....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump will likely face questions about  his executive order restricting some travel to the United States when he meets with the CEOs of major U.S. companies at the White House on Friday.

headline.main: Trump Likely to Face Questions Over Travel Ban in Meeting With CEOs
headline.print_headline: Trump Likely to Face Questions Over Travel Ban in Meeting With CEOs

docs.snippet: The largest U.S. physician group urged President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday to protect international doctors and seriously ill patients from an executive order that suspends travel from seven Muslim-majority countries....
docs.lead_paragraph: The largest U.S. physician group urged President Donald Trump's administration on Wednesday to protect international doctors and seriously ill patients from an executive order that suspends travel from seven Muslim-majority countries.

headline.main: Medical Group Urges Protection for Doctors, Patients After U.S. Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Medical Group Urges Protection for Doctors, Patients After U.S. Travel Ban

docs.snippet: The United Arab Emirates' foreign minister said on Wednesday President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens of seven mainly Muslim countries was an internal affair not directed at any faith, a more measure reaction than others from the region....
docs.lead_paragraph: The United Arab Emirates' foreign minister said on Wednesday President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens of seven mainly Muslim countries was an internal affair not directed at any faith, a more measure reaction than others from the region.

headline.main: UAE Says Trump Travel Ban an Internal Affair, Most Muslims Unaffected
headline.print_headline: UAE Says Trump Travel Ban an Internal Affair, Most Muslims Unaffected

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump defended his order to temporarily bar entry to people from seven majority-Muslim nations, which has come under intense criticism at home and abroad, saying on Thursday it was crucial to ensuring religious freedom and to...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump defended his order to temporarily bar entry to people from seven majority-Muslim nations, which has come under intense criticism at home and abroad, saying on Thursday it was crucial to ensuring religious freedom and tolerance in America.

headline.main: Trump Says His Travel Ban Needed to Ensure U.S. Religious Freedom
headline.print_headline: Trump Says His Travel Ban Needed to Ensure U.S. Religious Freedom

docs.snippet: Imposing a temporary travel ban on citizens from seven Muslim countries, President Donald Trump said the move would help protect the United States from terrorism. But less than one-third of Americans believe the move makes them "more safe," accord...
docs.lead_paragraph: Imposing a temporary travel ban on citizens from seven Muslim countries, President Donald Trump said the move would help protect the United States from terrorism. But less than one-third of Americans believe the move makes them "more safe," according to a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll released on Tuesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: Only a Third of Americans Think Trump's Travel Ban Will Make Them Safer
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: Only a Third of Americans Think Trump's Travel Ban Will Make Them Safer

docs.snippet: The Justice Department said that it would not fight for the travel ban and that President Trump would replace it with a “substantially revised executive order.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department said that it would not fight for the travel ban and that President Trump would replace it with a “substantially revised executive order.”

headline.main: Trump Will Issue New Travel Order Instead of Fighting Case in Court
headline.print_headline: Justice Dept. Drops Travel Ban Case, but Says a New Order Is Coming

headline.main: RADIO PROGRAMS SCHEDULED FOR CURRENT WEEK; RADIO PROGRAMS

docs.snippet: Australian dual-nationals will not be affected by U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order blocking visitors from seven Muslim-majority nations, Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Australian dual-nationals will not be affected by U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order blocking visitors from seven Muslim-majority nations, Australian Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Australia, U.S. Agree to Deal Exempting Australian Citizens From Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Australia, U.S. Agree to Deal Exempting Australian Citizens From Travel Ban

docs.snippet: The Pentagon was creating a list of Iraqis who had worked alongside U.S. troops, which will be passed to agencies implementing President Donald Trump's executive order restricting entry for people from Iraq and six other Muslim-majority countries,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Pentagon was creating a list of Iraqis who had worked alongside U.S. troops, which will be passed to agencies implementing President Donald Trump's executive order restricting entry for people from Iraq and six other Muslim-majority countries, a spokesman said on Monday.

headline.main: Pentagon Making List of Iraqis Who Worked Alongside U.S. Forces After Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Pentagon Making List of Iraqis Who Worked Alongside U.S. Forces After Travel Ban
